data.title: The Cramer Institute
data.meta_description: Dr. Kathy Cramer “I believe leaders can operate in the upper range of their potential. Imagine a world where leaders of organizations routinely do this. That’s where I want to live … and work.” This was the vision of Dr. Kathy Cramer, Ph.D., best-selling author, speaker, coach, trainer, executive consultant and founder of The Cramer...
data.text:
About Dr. Kathy Cramer

Kathryn D. Cramer, Ph.D., was passionate about showing leaders how to operate in the upper ranges of their potential. She dedicated her career to Asset-Based Thinking® (ABT), a way of looking at the world that helps leaders, influencers, and their teams make small shifts in thinking to produce extraordinary impact.

As a leadership development consultant, she worked with clients such as DuPont, Nestle Purina, Starbucks, and Microsoft, as well as many educational and non-profit organizations.

Dr. Kathy Cramer was a psychologist who authored nine books, including the best-selling book Change the Way You See Everything, which started the ABT movement in business, healthcare and education.

Accomplished Author

Dr. Kathy Cramer was a bestselling author, speaker and leadership development consultant. Kathy has written nine bestselling books including the best-seller Change the Way You See Everything, which started the Asset-Based Thinking® movement in business, healthcare and education. Her latest book, Lead Positive: What Highly Effective Leaders See, Say & Do, is a playbook for leaders who want to focus on strengths, solutions and game-changing results. The See-Say-Do framework shows leaders how to operate at the upper limits of their potential and how to help others do the same.
